Texto: 
decreased breath sounds in the left chest on ausculation by neonatologist.
the lesion was surgically resected.
frontal and lateral chest radiographs (fig. 1) demonstrates  a well-demarcated left posterior lung mass with preservation of the ribs and left paravertebral stripe.
sagittal ct image reconstruction (fig. 2) demonstrates a mixed fluid and solid components in the mass with scattered, air-filled cysts.
congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation
congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation
   (ccam)
intrapulmonary bronchogenic cyst
lung abscess (including parasitic)
congenital diaphragmatic hernia
hemothorax
2-day-old newborn with rapid breathing and intermittent desaturations.
